image.altText: Four packs of off-brand cigarettes sitting next to a red lighter on an outdoor green metal table.

props.synopsis: Doctors say smoking rates are at levels they haven't seen in a decade due to easy access to illegal cigarettes that are a "quarter of the price" of legal cigarettes.

title.children: Concerns 'off-brand' cigarettes easy to access and cheaper

image.altText: ACT Magistrate Court

props.synopsis: Three alleged kidnappers were trying to recover a $200,000 debt from a 52-year-old man in Monash on September 21, a court has heard, while rejecting their bail application.

title.children: Alleged kidnappers trying to recover $200,000, court hears

image.altText: Southwell Park sports field

props.synopsis:
Two men have been charged with assault after an alleged coward punch attack during a junior rugby sevens grand final on Sunday in which a referee was knocked unconscious.

title.children: Junior rugby referee hospitalised after alleged assault at under-14s game

image.altText: Brown Header

props.synopsis: Eight days into her new role as interim vice-chancellor at the Australian National University, Rebekah Brown sat down for an exclusive interview to share her plan for getting the institution back on track.

title.children: How the ANU's interim leader wants to turn its reputation around

image.altText: Blood pressure check

props.synopsis: The federal government says $10.5 million is being invested as "seed funding" to establish three new bulk billing clinics in Canberra, but the Australian Medical Association says it's not clear if this will resolve the issues facing the ACT long-term.

title.children: Funding for bulk billing in ACT but experts not sold

image.altText: Generic Drone of Homes

props.synopsis: The ACT government has passed legislation enshrining housing as a human right. What does that mean, and should other states follow?

title.children: Making housing a human right might not be the sole key to success

image.altText: Sarah, the Duchess of York, walking out wearing a white and black blazer, waving at the crowd with a black glove on her hand.

props.synopsis: The decisions come after British media reported that the Duchess had described the disgraced financier as a "steadfast, generous and supreme friend" in a 2011 letter.

title.children: Multiple charities cut ties with Duchess of York over email to Epstein

image.altText: Woman wearing a blue jacket speaks into a mic.

props.synopsis: Allies say they will not hesitate to shoot down Russian jets which violate NATO airspace in future siutations, after two jets entered Estonia's skies last week.

title.children: Russia warned airspace violations 'risk direct armed confrontation' with NATO

image.altText: Matt Rowell smiles wearing the Brownlow Medal

props.synopsis: Matt Rowell becomes the second Gold Coast player to win the prestigious AFL award, as a questionable voting call leaves the room stunned. Follow live.

title.children: Rowell takes out Brownlow Medal as vote snub stuns players

image.altText: A woman using an impact driver.

props.synopsis: A new report details the adversity faced by women in the residential construction sector revealing there is a lot of work to do once women are in the job to keep them there.Â

title.children: Female builders 'delaying childbirth' due to inflexible work conditions

image.altText: A composite of two images of Zin Wine with a Myanmar Academy Award and holding a protest sign.

props.synopsis: Myanmar's military junta is using citizenship as a weapon, targeting political opponents, activists and even celebrities who speak out against the regime.

title.children: Myanmar junta revoking citizenship of actors, singers and other celebrities

image.altText: A message reading "AI artificial intelligence", a keyboard, and robot hands are seen

title.children: 'Biggest gold rush' with AI set to revolutionise Australian economy

image.altText: Green sea turtle swimming in shallow waters at Hervey Bay

props.synopsis: Soft-shell syndrome had been devastating green sea turtle numbers since flood events began impacting their seagrass food source in 2022.

title.children: Cases of fatal necrotic turtle disease in decline but concerns remain

image.altText: man pushing shopping cart carrying shopping trolley in front of stacked boxes of chicken soup in supermarket. shoppers behind

props.synopsis: Hong Kong rushes to prepare for the arrival of Super Typhoon Ragasa with officials warning of a "serious threat" comparable to some of the most destructive storms in the city's recent history.

title.children: Typhoon Ragasa triggers alerts across Philippines, Taiwan and Hong Kong

props.synopsis: Community members who showed up for the meeting on the Inner West Council's Fairer Future Plan were turned away at the door after being told the venue was full.

title.children: Hundreds protest against 'poorly planned' apartment plan in Sydney

image.altText: A man in a hat being led to a police van by three police officers.

props.synopsis: New documents show some of the reasons why charges against a number of forest protesters were dropped in Tasmania, with police now assisting the company to stop it from happening in future.

title.children: Arrest of forest protesters 'compromised' by logging company mistake

image.altText: A man in a protest kicking a tear gas canister away.

props.synopsis: Italy's right-wing government, led by Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, says it does not plan to recognise Palestine at this stage.

title.children: Police clash with pro-Palestinian protesters in Italy

props.synopsis: Australia's school attendance levels have dropped since the pandemic but education experts are particularly concerned about Tasmania â a state with an already notoriously low literacy rate.

title.children: Calls for long-term plan to fix Tasmania's 'concerning' school attendance

image.altText: The Moldovan and European Union flags unfurled over the facade of a multi-storey building.

props.synopsis: The widespread raids came ahead of the country's parliamentary elections on Sunday, expected to determine whether the country will pursue closer ties with the European Union.

title.children: Moldova arrests 74 over alleged Russia-backed plot for unrest around election

image.altText: Long jetty with sun reflecting off the water

props.synopsis: With one of the nation's highest proportions of Airbnbs, some of WA's most popular tourist towns face a dilemma. Tourism is their biggest breadwinner â but with a housing crisis in full swing, short-term stays are pushing more and more locals away.

title.children: 'Literally no affordable housing': The holiday homes hollowing out towns

image.altText: A white, red and blue striped flag with a yellow embled hoisted at the top of a dome

props.synopsis: The UN's special rapporteur on rights in Russia says the Kremlin is resorting to coercive psychiatry measures to suppress anti-war dissidents.

title.children: Russia reviving Soviet-era tactics to quash dissent, says UN expert

image.altText: King Edward potatoes that are yellow skinned with some redish spots.

props.synopsis: The infected potato seeds, transported from Tasmania to Victoria, were found in cold storage and none have been planted.

title.children: Potato mop-top virus detected in Victoria for first time

image.altText: Old and new wind technology in south west Victoria

props.synopsis: VicGrid is cracking down on cowboys in the renewable energy sector, demanding that developers behave better or be refused access to the network.

title.children: VicGrid releases guidelines for renewables developers after community angst

image.altText: Masood Zakaria picture

props.synopsis: A major Sydney murder trial is at risk of falling over as a Supreme Court judge ruled there was evidence the man charged was deported back to Australia unlawfully.

title.children: Court finds 'credible' evidence accused gang boss was illegally deported

image.altText: Two young women crouching next to a greyhound. One holds a blue ribbon and the other hold a certificate.

props.synopsis: More than 30 South Australian greyhound trainers have threatened to boycott races after the departure of two animal re-homing staff who raised concerns about a dog's welfare.

image.altText: A man waves a Palestinian flag in front of police officers at Parliament House.

props.synopsis: While the Israel Defense Forces bomb Gaza and bulldoze the West Bank for settlements, moves to recognise Palestine in pursuit of a two-state solution may appear like something of a sick joke.Â

title.children: As Israel bombs Gaza, recognition of Palestine is a last-gasp effort

image.altText: An AI logo is shown in a conference

title.children: AI is 'coming at us fast'. But what exactly is it being used for right now?

image.altText: Donald Trump and Erika Kirk stand side by side on stage.

title.children: The main things you missed at Charlie Kirk's memorial

image.altText: a woman with brown hair speaking in front of a blue and green background

title.children: More customers caught in triple-0 failure as Optus awaits 'consequences'

props.synopsis: The Optus failure is shocking and no doubt a massive fine and other sanctions could be on the way, but experts say it raises further questions.

title.children: What do we expect when corporate executives run our telcos?

image.altText: A glass pipe, used for smoking the drug ice, sits on a bench.

props.synopsis: Police in the Kimberley say an ongoing investigation has seized millions of dollars' worth of methylamphetamine, ammunition and other drugs.

title.children: Illicit drugs worth $4 million intercepted by police in WA's far north

image.altText: A view from above showing three leopard sharks together in the ocean.

props.synopsis: A Sunshine Coast marine biologist has captured unique footage of two male sharks mating with a female in waters off New Caledonia.

title.children: Researcher captures three endangered sharks mating

image.altText: Matt Denny slips on the ground

props.synopsis: Matt Denny was one discus thrower who ended up slipping and sliding across the Tokyo National Stadium as heavy rain made the discus competition a farce.

title.children: 'Silly at this point': Pundits slam farcical end to discus finals

props.synopsis: Non-profit organisation MS Society SA & NT, which supports almost 3,000 clients living with multiple sclerosis, has gone into voluntary administration.
